stem: A client with Diabetic Ketoacidosis (DKA) has been on an IV insulin drip for 12 hours. Based on the documentation in the DKA Insulin & Metabolic Panel flowsheet, which finding indicates that the nurse can transition the client to subcutaneous insulin?

tabs.title: Metabolic Panel Trends
tabs.content:
TestAdmissionHour 6Hour 12 (Now)
Serum Glucose682 mg/dL240 mg/dL182 mg/dL
Anion Gap28 mEq/L18 mEq/L10 mEq/L
Serum Bicarbonate (HCO3)12 mEq/L16 mEq/L20 mEq/L
Serum Potassium (K+)5.8 mEq/L4.2 mEq/L3.8 mEq/L

tabs.title: Nursing Notes
tabs.content: Hour 12: Client is alert, oriented, and reporting 'extreme hunger.' No nausea or vomiting. Abdomen soft; non-tender. Kussmaul respirations have ceased.

tabs.title: Provider Orders
tabs.content:
1. IV Regular Insulin at 0.1 units/kg/hr.
2. Transition to SQ insulin when: Glucose < 200, HCO3 >= 18, and Anion Gap < 12, and patient is able to tolerate PO intake.

options.text: The closure of the anion gap to 10 mEq/L
The serum glucose level of 182 mg/dL
The serum potassium level of 3.8 mEq/L

rationale.correct: The most definitive indicator of DKA resolution and readiness for SQ insulin transition is the **closure of the anion gap (a1)**. While glucose (a2) often drops quickly, the underlying acidosis (indicated by the anion gap) takes longer to resolve. A gap of 10 mEq/L (Normal is < 12) indicates that the accumulation of ketoacids has ceased and the metabolic acidosis has resolved. Per the provider orders, the client also meets the glucose, bicarbonate, and oral intake criteria.
clinicalPearls: DKA is fixed when the **Acidosis** is fixed, not just the sugar.
Anion Gap = Sodium - (Chloride + Bicarbonate). A gap > 12 indicates metabolic acidosis.
Always overlap the first SQ insulin dose with the IV insulin drip for 1-2 hours to prevent rebound ketosis.

questionTrap.trap: Thinking glucose < 200 is the only requirement for transition.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Remember 'The Gap before the Glide.' You must close the anion gap (H+) before you glide off the IV insulin. If you stop the IV drip too early, the patient will flip back into DKA even if their sugar is 150.

mnemonic.title: DKA Done
mnemonic.expansion: G-Glucose < 200. A-Anion Gap < 12. P-Patient is eating (PO).
